article.headline: Robert Morris 79, Youngstown State 78
article.story: CORAOPOLIS, Pa. (AP) -- Tony Lee scored 16 of his 23 points in the second half to lead Robert Morris to a 79-78 win over Youngstown State on Saturday night. Quin Humphrey had 25 points and Keston Roberts 23 for the Penguins (4-7), who had won two straight after a four-game losing streak. John Barber had 10 points and 10 rebounds for Youngstown State. Freddie Harris had a career-high 16 points, and Jeremy Chappell 15 for Robert Morris (6-3). The Colonials six nonconference victories are their most since the 1989-90 season. Robert Morris took the lead in the first five minutes of the game and never looked back. Youngstown State closed within 71-70 with 3:16 to left and got within 79-78 when Roberts hit a 3-pointer in the closing seconds. Lee took the ensuing inbounds pass unguarded beyond the midcourt line to run out the clock. Robert Morris led by as many as 14 with 13 minutes to play, but the Penguins went on a 9-1 run. The Colonials shot 51.8 percent from the field. Seventeen of their 29 shots came off of assists.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
